content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is an implementation in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return [word for word in words if isuppercase(first(word))]
end
```
This function uses the `isuppercase` function to check if the first character of a word is uppercase. If it is, then the word is included in the result list. 

Please note that this solution assumes that we are considering words as individual strings and not characters. Also, in case when you have non-English letters and want to check only for English capitalized letters, you may need to use `isascii(first(word))` instead of `isuppercase(first(word))`.
